title: Monogenic function
summary: A monogenic [1][2] function is a complex function with a single finite derivative. More precisely, a function f ( z ) {\displaystyle f(z)} defined on A ⊆ C {\displaystyle A\subseteq \mathbb {C} } is called monogenic at ζ ∈ A {\displaystyle \zeta \in A} , if f ′ ( ζ ) {\displaystyle f'(\zeta )} exists and is finite, with:
